definitions: going beyond what is reasonable, necessary, or normal in amount or degree
exceeding the usual, proper, or specified limits in quantity or extent
examples: The excessive heat made outdoor activities dangerous today
His excessive spending on luxury items worried his family
The teacher complained about excessive noise from the playground
Excessive rainfall caused flooding in several neighborhoods this spring

definitions: so numerous that counting is impossible or impractical
examples: She received countless messages of support after the announcement
The night sky displayed countless stars on that clear evening

definitions: situated within or inside something, especially within a building or structure
located in the inland part of a country or region, away from the coast
relating to the internal or domestic affairs of a country or organization
examples: The interior walls need repainting before the new tenants arrive
She hired a designer to renovate the interior spaces completely
They traveled to the interior regions to study indigenous cultures
The interior provinces experience more extreme temperature variations than coastal areas
The interior minister announced new policies for border security yesterday
Interior affairs of the nation took precedence over foreign policy

definitions: remaining loyal and steadfast in allegiance, affection, or duty to someone or something
true to the facts or the original; representing something accurately without deviation
examples: Her faithful dog waited by the door every evening for her
He remained faithful to his principles despite intense pressure to compromise
The movie is a faithful adaptation of the classic novel
This translation provides a faithful rendering of the original text

definitions: suffering from feelings of severe despondency, sadness, and hopelessness
pushed down or lowered below the normal or usual position or level
experiencing economic decline with reduced activity and high unemployment
examples: She felt depressed after losing her job last month unexpectedly
The depressed teenager finally sought help from a school counselor
The depressed button needs to be released before restarting the machine
Heavy snow left a depressed area in the roof structure
The depressed economy led to widespread business closures and unemployment
Property values remained depressed in the region for several years

definitions: feeling or showing self-consciousness, shame, or awkwardness in a social situation
examples: He felt embarrassed when he tripped in front of everyone
She was too embarrassed to admit she forgot the meeting

definitions: causing anxiety, worry, or unease; troubling to one's peace of mind
examples: The disturbing news about climate change worried many young people
She found the violent scenes in the movie deeply disturbing

definitions: stated clearly and in detail, leaving no room for confusion or doubt
describing or showing sexual or violent material in graphic detail without censorship
examples: The contract contains explicit instructions about payment terms and deadlines
She gave explicit directions to avoid any confusion about location
The movie received an explicit rating due to violent content
Some websites require age verification before showing explicit material online

definitions: new, original, or unusual in an interesting and striking way
examples: Scientists discovered a novel approach to treating the rare disease
Her novel idea for recycling plastic impressed the environmental committee

definitions: capable of working successfully or being effective in practice; feasible
examples: The business plan seems viable given current market conditions favorably
Solar energy is becoming a more viable alternative to fossil fuels

definitions: unwilling and hesitant to do something; showing doubt or unwillingness
examples: She was reluctant to share personal information with new colleagues
The reluctant witness finally agreed to testify in court yesterday

definitions: not easily bent or changed in shape; rigid and difficult to move
formal, unfriendly, or lacking ease in manner or movement
severe, difficult, or requiring great effort to overcome or achieve
examples: My neck feels stiff after sleeping in an awkward position
The stiff cardboard was perfect for making the display stand
His stiff manner made guests feel uncomfortable at the party
The conversation remained stiff despite attempts to lighten the mood
The company faces stiff competition from international manufacturers this year
She passed the exam despite stiff questions on advanced topics

definitions: following each other continuously in unbroken or logical sequence without interruption
examples: The team won five consecutive games to reach the championship finals
It rained for seven consecutive days causing widespread flooding problems

definitions: connected with something else in one's mind or in fact; related
examples: The associate professor taught advanced chemistry courses this semester exclusively
These symptoms are commonly associate with seasonal allergies in spring

definitions: involving the possibility of danger, failure, or loss; hazardous
examples: Investing in startups can be risky but potentially very rewarding
The risky mountain climb required experienced guides and safety equipment

definitions: having no marks, writing, or decoration; empty of content or detail
showing no emotion, understanding, or interest in facial expression
examples: Please sign your name on the blank line at the bottom
She stared at the blank page unable to write anything
His blank expression gave no hint of his true feelings
She gave him a blank look when he mentioned the meeting

definitions: producing good or helpful results or effects; conferring benefits advantageous
examples: Regular exercise is beneficial for both physical and mental health
The new policy proved beneficial to small business owners particularly

definitions: offensively impolite or ill-mannered in behavior or speech toward others
examples: It's rude to interrupt people when they are speaking politely
The rude customer yelled at staff over a minor mistake

definitions: become aware of, understood, or interpreted in a particular way through senses or mind
examples: The perceived threat turned out to be a false alarm entirely
Her perceived lack of interest was actually just extreme shyness

definitions: extending on all sides of something; encircling or encompassing an area
examples: The surrounding mountains provide shelter from harsh winter winds effectively
Police searched the surrounding area for clues about the incident

definitions: feeling embarrassed, guilty, or disgraced about one's actions, characteristics, or associations
examples: He felt ashamed of his behavior at the party last night
She was ashamed to admit she had never learned to swim

definitions: extremely impressive or beautiful in a way that amazes or delights
causing shock, surprise, or astonishment due to being unexpected or remarkable
examples: The bride looked stunning in her elegant white wedding dress
The sunset created a stunning display of colors across the sky
The election results were stunning to political analysts nationwide yesterday
Her stunning performance earned a standing ovation from the audience

definitions: having bright sunlight with few or no clouds in the sky
cheerful, optimistic, and positive in mood or disposition consistently
examples: The sunny weather made it perfect for our beach picnic today
We enjoyed three sunny days during our mountain camping trip
Her sunny personality brightened everyone's mood at the office daily
Despite setbacks, he maintained a sunny outlook on life always

definitions: very strange or unusual in a way that causes surprise or bewilderment
examples: The artist's bizarre sculptures attracted curious visitors to the gallery
It was bizarre to see snow falling in the desert
